description: The Centralized Enabling Workplace Fund (CEWF), a division of the Office for Public Service Accessibility (OPSA) at Treasury Board Secretariat, requires a communication specialist skilled in accessible design for the development and testing of the digital solution application of the Government of Canada’s Workplace Accessibility Passport. The GC Workplace Accessibility Passport is one of the flagship initiatives of the Centralized Enabling Workplace Fund, which invests in innovative projects to advance workplace accessibility for public servants.  In its current Word or rtf document formats, the Passport can be used immediately. Once completed, it is stored by the employee to ensure privacy and portability. Under this project, the CEWF is developing an accessible and secure online version of the Passport which will be extensively tested with users before its implementation.

* Selection Criteria: Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price

### Business Description
The Treasury Board Secretariat is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for a Communications Specialist to support the development and testing of an accessible online digital solution for the Government of Canada's Workplace Accessibility Passport.

#### Background Information
The Centralized Enabling Workplace Fund invests in innovative projects to advance workplace accessibility for public servants. The selected candidate will be responsible for ensuring the digital application is both accessible and secure.

### Services Required
The successful contractor will be required to provide expert-level services in accessible design and communication to support the development and testing of the digital solution.

### Contract Details
* Contracting Entity: Treasury Board of Canada Secretariat
* Contract Value: To be determined
* Contract Period: 2023-12-01 to 2024-11-30

### Tender Submission
Proposal submissions will be accepted only from qualified bidders who are pre-approved under Supply Arrangement (Article E60ZN-18TSPS) for service in the National Capital Region (Category 1 for Communications services)
